abstract: President Obama received a jubilant reception from the audience at a dinner held by the Human Rights Campaign, one of the nation's largest gay rights groups.
snippet: President Obama received a jubilant reception from the audience at a dinner held by the Human Rights Campaign, one of the nation's largest gay rights groups.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON -- President Obama, speaking two weeks after the military ended a ban on openly gay service members, told a prominent gay-rights group here on Saturday night that "no one has to live a lie to serve the country they love."

headline.main: Obama Criticizes Republicans Over Booing of Gay Soldier
